messages.content: You will receive your postal ballot papers in the next few days for the local and national elections. You have a choice locally and nationally and the elections are very important.
The Liberal Democrats have run Liverpool for 12 years now, bringing new investment and improving your city like never before.
Mumin Khan is committed to ensuring the Liberal Democrats continue to build Liverpool for the future, whilst delivering the pledges they have committed to.

Mumin will work hard to: keep your council tax to a minimum, cut crime, ensure future investment in children's education, create 10,000 new jobs in Liverpool by 2015 and they will develop new power and funding to let you take more control over how you live, vote and to fundamentally change the future of your area.

We cannot afford to let Labour take us back to the bad old days; a vote for any other political Party could mean Liverpool going backwards. You only have to look at the Labour Governments recent record, with 'corruption' rife in our national political system.

Nationally the Liberal Democrats will work to: give a tax cut to the lowest paid by scrapping the tax on the first £10,000 you earn, put more police on the streets, let teachers teach, tax greedy bankers and reform the political system so that the expenses scandal can never happen again.

It's crucial you cast your votes, and I am urging you to vote for Mumin Khan - LIBERAL DEMOCRAT on your yellow ballot paper, and Richard Marbrow - LIBERAL DEMOCRAT on the white General election ballot paper.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Keep council tax to a minimum.
Ensure future investment in children's education.
Create 10,000 new jobs in Liverpool by 2015.
Develop new power and funding to let you take more control over how you live, vote and to fundamentally change the future of your area.
Give a tax cut to the lowest paid by scrapping the tax on the first £10,000 you earn.
Put more police on the streets.
Reform the political system to prevent expenses scandal.

issues.education: Ensure future investment in children's education.
issues.governance: Reform the political system to prevent expenses scandal.
issues.socialWelfare: Give a tax cut to the lowest paid by scrapping the tax on the first £10,000 you earn.

politicalExperience.achievements: Ran Liverpool, bringing new investment and improving the city like never before.
